    Describe HoNOS items, severity scores, and clusters

    describe_honos.Rmd

    Describe HoNOS item labels

    • as_item_desc(): Add item descriptions (For 13 and 18 item versions of the HoNOS)
    library(honos)
#> This is honos 0.1.1
#> honos is currently in development -function names and arguments might change.
#> PLEASE REPORT ANY BUGS!

honos_long %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(item_desc = as_item_desc(item, n_items = 13))
#> # A tibble: 39,000 x 6
#>    id    date       measure item  value item_desc                               
#>    <fct> <date>     <chr>   <fct> <dbl> <fct>                                   
#>  1 id1   2018-08-05 honos   1         2 Scale 1: Overactive, aggressive, disrup…
#>  2 id1   2018-08-05 honos   2         4 Scale 2: Non-accidental self-injury     
#>  3 id1   2018-08-05 honos   3         2 Scale 3: Problem drinking or drug taking
#>  4 id1   2018-08-05 honos   4         3 Scale 4: Cognitive problems             
#>  5 id1   2018-08-05 honos   5         2 Scale 5: Physical illness or disability…
#>  6 id1   2018-08-05 honos   6        NA Scale 6: Hallucinations and Delusions   
#>  7 id1   2018-08-05 honos   7         1 Scale 7: Depressed mood                 
#>  8 id1   2018-08-05 honos   8         0 Scale 8: Other mental and behavioural p…
#>  9 id1   2018-08-05 honos   9         1 Scale 9: Relationships                  
#> 10 id1   2018-08-05 honos   10        3 Scale 10: Activities of daily living    
#> # … with 38,990 more rows

    In item 8, the clinician can specify 10 different categories. The function as_i8_desc() can be used to add more detailed labels, for example:

    as_i8_desc("B")
#> [1] Type B: Anxiety
#> 10 Levels: Type A: Phobic Type B: Anxiety ... Type J: Other, specify

    Describe HoNOS severity scores

    • as_severity_desc(): Add severity descriptions (Values ‘0’ to ‘4’)
    library(honos)

honos_long %>% 
  dplyr::mutate(value_desc = as_severity_desc(value, na_level = "I AM A MISSING VALUE"))
#> # A tibble: 39,000 x 6
#>    id    date       measure item  value value_desc                   
#>    <fct> <date>     <chr>   <fct> <dbl> <fct>                        
#>  1 id1   2018-08-05 honos   1         2 Mild problem                 
#>  2 id1   2018-08-05 honos   2         4 Severe to very severe problem
#>  3 id1   2018-08-05 honos   3         2 Mild problem                 
#>  4 id1   2018-08-05 honos   4         3 Moderately severe problem    
#>  5 id1   2018-08-05 honos   5         2 Mild problem                 
#>  6 id1   2018-08-05 honos   6        NA I AM A MISSING VALUE         
#>  7 id1   2018-08-05 honos   7         1 Minor problem                
#>  8 id1   2018-08-05 honos   8         0 No problem                   
#>  9 id1   2018-08-05 honos   9         1 Minor problem                
#> 10 id1   2018-08-05 honos   10        3 Moderately severe problem    
#> # … with 38,990 more rows

    Describe clusters

    • as_cluster_desc(): Describe clusters (Values: 0 to 21)
    
library(honos)
x <- 0:21
as_cluster_desc(x)
#>  [1] Care Cluster 0: Variance                                                                
#>  [2] Care Cluster 1: Common mental health problems (Low severity)                            
#>  [3] Care Cluster 2: Common mental health problems (Low severity with greater need)          
#>  [4] Care Cluster 3: Non-psychotic (Moderate severity)                                       
#>  [5] Care Cluster 4: Non-psychotic (Severe)                                                  
#>  [6] Care Cluster 5: Non-psychotic disorders (Very severe)                                   
#>  [7] Care Cluster 6: Non-psychotic disorder of over-valued ideas                             
#>  [8] Care Cluster 7: Enduring non-psychotic disorders (High disability)                      
#>  [9] Care Cluster 8: Non-psychotic chaotic and challenging disorders                         
#> [10] Care Cluster 9: Blank cluster                                                           
#> [11] Care Cluster 10: First episode psychosis (With / without manic features)                
#> [12] Care Cluster 11: Ongoing recurrent psychosis (Low symptoms)                             
#> [13] Care Cluster 12: Ongoing or recurrent psychosis (High disability)                       
#> [14] Care Cluster 13: Ongoing or recurrent psychosis (High symptom and disability)           
#> [15] Care Cluster 14: Psychotic crisis                                                       
#> [16] Care Cluster 15: Severe psychotic depression                                            
#> [17] Care Cluster 16: Psychosis and affective disorder (High substance misuse and engagement)
#> [18] Care Cluster 17: Psychosis and affective disorder – difficult to engage                 
#> [19] Care Cluster 18: Cognitive impairment (Low need)                                        
#> [20] Care Cluster 19: Cognitive impairment or dementia complicated (Moderate need)           
#> [21] Care Cluster 20: Cognitive impairment or dementia complicated (High need)               
#> [22] Care Cluster 21: Cognitive impairment or dementia (High physical or engagement)         
#> 22 Levels: Care Cluster 0: Variance ...
